decks.notes: The main theme of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up a strong board presence with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down the opponent's spells and abilities, combined with powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice to boost your creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Using cards like Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to cheat out creatures and equipment, along with disruptive lands like Karakas and Rishadan Port, this deck aims to control the game and come out on top in combat.

This deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Delver of Secrets, True-Name Nemesis, and Young Pyromancer, supported by efficient tempo plays such as Daze and Stifle. The deck also includes disruption with counterspells like Force of Will and removal spells like Lightning Bolt. The mana base is focused on providing access to the deck's two main colors, blue and red, as well as utilizing Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck seeks to apply early pressure and maintain control of the game through a mix of threats and answers.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful spells and versatile creatures, with a strong emphasis on card advantage and efficiency. It utilizes a combination of counterspells, removal, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also generating incremental value through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Ice-Fang Coatl. The inclusion of versatile planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Teferi, Time Raveler adds additional control elements to the deck. The mana base is designed to support the deck's various color requirements while also maximizing the efficiency of cards like Arcum's Astrolabe and Mystic Sanctuary.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with efficient creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. It utilizes mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and mana fixing from cards like Windswept Heath and Verdant Catacombs. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Collector Ouphe and Gaddock Teeg to hinder opponents' strategies. The toolbox nature of the deck is highlighted by cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Knight of Autumn, providing flexibility in dealing with different threats. The inclusion of equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull enhances the deck's combat capabilities.

This UR Aggro deck utilizes low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Dreadhorde Arcanist, as well as efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes countermagic in the form of Daze, Force of Will, and Force of Negation to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a focus on tempo and aggression, this deck aims to close out games quickly while maintaining a disruptive presence on the board.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate to tax their spells, while also applying pressure with creatures like Mirran Crusader and Palace Jailer. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Mother of Runes and Flickerwisp, while also utilizing equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Swords of Fire and Ice to provide additional value. The deck also utilizes mana denial with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port to further disrupt the opponent and maintain tempo advantage.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck focuses on the combo strategy of reanimating powerful creatures. The key concept revolves around quickly filling the graveyard with key creatures, such as Griselbrand and Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite, using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting. The deck also utilizes cards like Animate Dead and Reanimate to bring these creatures back onto the battlefield in a fast and efficient manner. Additionally, the deck includes disruption elements such as Cabal Therapy and Unmask to disrupt opponent's strategies. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures early in the game.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo using cards like Thespian's Stage and Vampire Hexmage, while disrupting opponents with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes cards to help protect the combo, such as Sylvan Safekeeper and Karakas. Mox Diamond and Once Upon a Time help with mana acceleration and consistency, while Elvish Reclaimer provides additional utility and searching capabilities. Overall, the goal is to efficiently win the game through the powerful Dark Depths combo while controlling the opponent's resources.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board with efficient creatures and burn spells, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells and land destruction. By playing threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Dreadhorde Arcanist, the deck looks to apply pressure and win the game quickly. The inclusion of Force of Will and Spell Pierce helps protect your threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy, allowing you to maintain tempo and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a high amount of mana quickly using cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, in order to cast multiple spells in a turn and build up a lethal amount of storm count. The deck aims to use powerful spells like Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent in a single explosive turn. It also includes cards like Veil of Summer and Defense Grid to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategies. Additionally, cards like Burning Wish provide additional versatility and options for the combo player.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Cloudpost and Glimmerpost while utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures alongside a variety of colorless spells and artifacts. The goal is to establish a massive mana advantage early on, disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void, and then finish them off with game-ending threats such as Emrakul, the Promised End and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. By carefully managing resources and timing plays, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its explosive and versatile strategies.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Cloudpost and Glimmerpost lands, utilizing powerful mana rocks like Grim Monolith and Thran Dynamo. The goal is to cast big Eldrazi threats like Ulamog and Kozilek, while disrupting opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Ugin to control the board. The inclusion of cards like Manifold Key and Sorcerous Spyglass provide additional utility and disruption options, making it a versatile and powerful combo deck in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents while applying pressure with efficient creatures and equipments. It utilizes disruptive lands like Wasteland and Rishadan Port along with taxing creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down opponents. Stoneforge Mystic tutors for powerful equipments like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull to enhance the board presence. Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment and Flickerwisp provides additional disruptive plays. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and overwhelm opponents with a mix of disruption and aggression.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Gurmag Angler, supported by disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze to control the board and pressure the opponent. It also incorporates removal spells such as Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats efficiently. The deck aims to maintain a strong tempo advantage by disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with its efficient threats, ultimately overwhelming the opponent and securing a quick victory.

The deck is focused on quickly assembling a combo using cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Dark Ritual to generate mana, while utilizing wish cards like Burning Wish to find the combo pieces needed to win the game. The inclusion of cards like Defense Grid and Veil of Summer helps protect the combo from disruption, allowing the player to go off and cast a Tendrils of Agony for lethal damage. The deck aims to win the game in a single turn and is built around speed and efficiency to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on using lands to control the opponent's resources while recurring key cards like Punishing Fire and Abrupt Decay with Life from the Loam. It utilizes cards like Chalice of the Void and Liliana of the Veil to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Dark Confidant provide additional value and threats. The inclusion of Sylvan Library offers card advantage and selection, while Oko, Thief of Crowns serves as a versatile threat and disruption tool. Overall, the deck aims to grind out opponents with a combination of control elements and powerful threats.
